question.body: Which of the following is the most comprehensive list of factors that can affect blood pressure?

multiple_choice.choice: heart rate, blood viscosity, and vascular diameters
heart rate, stroke volume, blood viscosity, vessel lengths, and vascular diameters
heart rate, blood viscosity, stroke volume, vascular diameter, vessel length, and hematocrit

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although both of these contribute to blood pressure, they can each be divided into more factors.
Incorrect. Although each of these factors can affect blood pressure, the list is not comprehensive.

Correct. Blood pressure is determined by multiplying cardiac output with vascular resistance. Cardiac output is calculated as stroke volume times heart rate and vascular resistance is determined by vessel diameter (radius), vessel length and the viscosity of the fluid.
Incorrect. Although this list is quite comprehensive, hematocrit helps determine blood viscosity, but they are not separate factors.
